page.title: 12Communications.
page.content: The majority of homes have the telephone installed by British Telecom and pay a quarterly account.Two public telephone kiosks are sited in Linton-on-Ouse,one being on the R.A.F. Station and one in Newton-on-Ouse.An automatic telephone exchange is situated between the two villages. The Post Office has a branch in a village shop in Linton,open four and a half days a week,Newton having lost its Post Office several years ago.Mail is collected from three post-boxes in Linton and one in Newton,twice a day,once on Saturday and never on Sunday.A delivery of mail,brought from York,is made once a day. In Widdington there is no Post Office.Mail is delivered to one farm, the other two householders collecting it from the village two miles away.
